summary: OpenTelemetry interceptors package modifies the global object to add a `window` property when imported, affecting code outside the workflow isolate that depends on `typeof window === "undefined"` checks. This breaks existing Node.js projects that use this common pattern to detect browser vs server environments.
userImpact: Existing Node.js projects that rely on `typeof window === "undefined"` for environment detection break when using OpenTelemetry interceptors, as the global `window` property is added outside the workflow isolate.
rootCause: The OpenTelemetry interceptors modify the global object to add a `window` property for workflow isolate compatibility, but this modification happens during import and affects the entire Node.js process rather than being scoped to the workflow isolate.
proposedFix: Scope the global modifications to only affect code inside the workflow isolate, or avoid modifying globals altogether.
keyQuote: This modification may be necessary within the workflow isolate, but this code is also required outside the workflow isolate when just booting the worker
